descript.abstract: Metro Stations (regional). The dataset contains points representing locations and attributes of Metro stations, created as part of the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and participating D.C. government agencies. Platform centroids were identified from visual observation of orthophotography and extracted planimetric data. Centroids were heads-up digitized from the snapbase. METADATA CONTENT IS IN PROCESS OF VALIDATION AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE.
descript.purpose: This data is used for the planning and management of Washington, D.C. by local government agencies.

cntorgp.cntorg: D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer

attracc.attraccr: Data believed to be complete and accurate, subject to change. Digital version compared with original source data for accuracy and completeness.

dataqual.logic: Not validated by source and/or responsible agency.
dataqual.complete: Data believed to be complete and accurate, subject to change. Digital version compared with original source data for accuracy and completeness. In process of validation by source and/or responsible agency.

horizpa.horizpar: In process of validation by source and/or responsible agency.

citeinfo.title: WMATA website
citeinfo.othercit: Website visited April and June 2001 and May 2002 for validation.

procstep.procdesc: For the blue line extension, platform centroids were identified from visual observation of orthophotography and a centroid for each heads-up digitized from the 2003 orthophotographs. Also, using the more accurate metro lines from the WMATA Surveyor's office, staff moved the stations to better fit with the metro lines. Attribute data was provided by the WMATA website.

cntorgp.cntorg: Office of the Chief Technology Officer

procstep.procdesc: Staff modified the layer to reflect the yellow line extension.

cntorgp.cntorg: Office of the Chief Technology Officer

procstep.procdesc: An ADDRESS field was added and populated using data from WMATA's website.
A LINE field was added. The field describe the color of the line each station is located on.

Platform centroids were identified from visual observation of orthophotography and extracted planimetric data and a centroid for each heads-up digitized from the 1995 orthophotographs. Attribute data was provided by the WMATA website. Planimetrics were created at a scale of 1:1,000. This means that a well defined feature falls within two feet of true position. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters.

cntorgp.cntorg: D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer

procstep.procdesc: Added yellow and orange line rush plus information.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
